column4: ok, so i've been using the ubuntu live cd for a while, and so far it just seems like my normal linux except with pre-prettified gnome (yes, i like the brown too). What can i do to experience the ubuntuness and perhaps become an ubuntu convert?
hm. ubuntu is very consistent and has good docs. try www.ubuntu.com docs and www.ubuntuguide.org
what do you mean by consistent? the docs certainly seem good, but they seem to ubuntu-specific. the docs let me solve all my problems practically, but i rarely seem to learn much
as for me ubuntu works out of the box. there are some quirks. if you are win32 convert then without little suppoort (live i mean not by net) from someone...
...more exp it will be hard. but if you are familiar with linux, ubuntu is ready for you.
you have to answer critical question: what do you need from computer? then visit docs and get a clue if ubuntu is good for you.

ubuntu definitely seems a great "out-of-the-box" distro. no denying that. though arch is quite the opposite, and i'm loving that. i'm just curious how the other half lives! once again, i DO like the brown...
eh. i much better ubuntu-advocate and zealot in my native language :D
dont worry. zealotry knows no borders
ah,. i forgot ;) in that sentence :D
why do YOU use ubuntu?
hehe. right now not exactly...: shufla@hardin:~> cat /etc/issue | grep Welcome
and why i do use (@home, @servers)? 1. debian based (i know debian, i can do some packages if i need).
2. desktop is ready to go and it's spartan.
3. got up to dated apps, java support is not oob, but well documented
4. #ubuntu, ubuntuforums.org
99. Ubuntu just fits me.
if you werent already so .deb and apt proficient, what are the chances you'd still use a debian based system?
2 years waiting for sarge.
so there is such a thing is TOO much foreplay?
well. i do not understand you.
